page.title: 11MARKET GARDENING
page.content: Nick Vrijland's Nursery in West Cranleigh has one of the largest areas under glass in the country. He grows mainly lettuces and has been in business for 17 years. The lettuces are grown in two ways. The Danish way when they grow on a layer of plastic to avoid soil diseases with holes for the roots to reach the soil. The other way is just planting them in the soil. They grow three types of lettuce, crisp ones which keep well, iceberg which are tightly wrapped and butterhead which have to be eaten quickly. The workers pick them by hand and put them into boxes of 12. They send 7_8000 boxes a week to Supermarkets and shops all over England. There are 16_17 workers who come from all over Europe and N. Africa.
